job_description: Job Description Work closely with our clients to develop product and configure the application to their business environment Work within a team & communicate effectively across teams Deal with technical challenges, programing tasks while managing client expectations and building long-term customer relations Implement assigned tasks from client/manager Job Requirements MUST HAVE SKILLS: From 1+ years of experience in Python Experience with any Python Web Framework: Django/FastAPI/Flask Experience working with Jinja2 Experience with Python ORM: SQLAlchemy, Pydantic Experience working with Docker, Git, Git flow, CI/CD Experience with Unit Test, Intergration Test Experience with Scaling and Building Stable Systems Have knowledge with Caching, DB, DB design Good at English NICE TO HAVE Experience with AI/ML/DL, especially ChatGPT and OpenAI... integration Experience with Data Engineer, Big Data/ ETL/ Airflow Experience working with micro-service projects Experience with NoSQL (MongoDB/DynamoDB), Vector Database (OpenSearch, Qdrant...) location: Qu·∫≠n 12, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: Job Overview bTaskee is looking for an extremely impressive Data Engineer to build and optimize data pipelines, ensuring seamless integration, quality, security, and scalability. We appreciate you taking the time to review the list of qualifications and to apply for the position. If you don‚Äôt fill all of the qualifications, you may still be considered depending on your level of experience. Responsibilities And Duties Design, build, and maintain efficient data pipelines and ETL processes; Optimize data systems for performance, reliability, and scalability; Collaborate closely with data scientists and analysts to support their data needs; Ensure data quality, security, and integrity across all platforms; Manage structured and unstructured data solutions effectively; Monitor data system performance, identify bottlenecks, and troubleshoot issues proactively; Maintain best practices for data governance and documentation. Qualifications And Skills Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, or a related field; Minimum 2 years of experience as a Data Engineer, particularly in AI-driven environments; Expertise in programming languages such as Python, or Golang; Extensive experience with technologies such as Kafka, Kubernetes, and SQL/NoSQL databases; Solid understanding of data modeling, real-time processing, and database management; Optimize data flows for real-time analytics, machine learning, and decision-making processes; Monitor data pipelines and infrastructure proactively, resolving issues promptly; Familiarity with real-time streaming and event-driven architectures; Nice to have Knowledge of data orchestration tools like Apache Airflow; A strong background in Agentic AI or autonomous system projects is a big plus. Why You'll Love Working Here Professional development: Upgrade your skills and ignite your career; Collaborative atmosphere: Everyone works together to execute the mission; Team spirit: Caring for our people and bonding together are musts for us; Dynamic growth: Our teams are scaling up quickly as the recruiting market is booming. There‚Äôs no better time than now to come on board; bTaskee has a diverse, international, and supportive community culture. Our English-speaking environment lets you improve your language skills. At bTaskee, we don‚Äôt just work ‚Äì we thrive with top-notch benefits! Competitive Salary ‚Äì Rewarded based on your experience and skills; Annual Performance Review ‚Äì Unlock growth opportunities every year; KPI-Based Salary ‚Äì Earn what you deserve through your contributions; 13th-Month Bonus ‚Äì Rewarded based on both your performance and the company‚Äôs success; BYOD Support ‚Äì Get an allowance while enjoying the flexibility of using your own laptop; Comprehensive Healthcare ‚Äì Regular check-ups & a premium health package; SHUI Compliance ‚Äì Contributions aligned with legal regulations; Generous Leave Policy ‚Äì Enjoy 12‚Äì16 annual leave days per year; Celebration Perks ‚Äì Special benefits for birthdays, weddings, childbirth, and more; Engaging Workplace ‚Äì Activities & exciting team-building events; Advance Home Care Benefit ‚Äì Get a monthly bTaskee package, freeing up your time for learning, relaxation, and self-care. Working Schedule : Monday to Friday - 09:00 AM to 06:00 PM Working Location : HQ Tower - 201 Tran Nao, An Khanh Ward, Thu Duc City, HCMC.

location: Vietnam
job_description: Introduction Holistics is a Business Intelligence platform built for the AI era. We are the team behind projects like the BI tool Holistics, the database diagram tool dbdiagram.io, and the open-source project dbml.org. We help data teams build a trusted, supervised self-service analytics experience for their business stakeholders. We are searching for an Analytics Engineer (junior to mid-level) to help us evolve our data pipeline to support internal decisions, as well as helping our customers get more value of Holistics BI platform. This is a full-time role based in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam , with a flexible, hybrid WFH/WFO setup. ‚Äç What You Will Do This role is a hybrid of technical analytics work and customer-facing engagements. Your time will be allocated across two core functions. Internal data pipeline/modeling & BI: You will actively contribute to our internal data & BI platform, ensuring our internal stakeholders get the data they need Manage and enhance internal data pipeline: Contribute to the maintenance of our internal data ingestion, transformation, and reporting pipeline, ensuring data is timely and correct. This hands-on work will be a source of direct feedback for our product team. Build best-practice data models: Develop and refactor internal data models using dbt, following data modeling paradigms like Kimball/Inmon and star/snowflake schemas. These models will serve as real-world examples for customer education. Ensure data quality and integrity: Implement data tests and validation checks to ensure internal metrics are calculated correctly, translating these practices into customer-facing guidance. Research and experiment with new tools: Test-drive emerging BI and analytics engineering tools, evaluate how they might enhance our demos or internal stack, and share your findings with the product and marketing teams. Customer engagement: Besides working on internal data pipeline, you‚Äôll also get the chance to engage with our customers directly on their analytics projects Guide customer onboarding: Work directly with new customers via shared Slack channels, review their data warehouse schemas, and coach them on data modeling best practices Develop enablement assets: Convert modeling best practices and hard-won insights into step-by-step guides, sample Git repositories, and short video tutorials so customers and internal teams can self-serve. Deliver scoped consulting: Spend focused time helping strategic accounts solve complex data modeling challenges, then document the patterns for future projects and content. Our current data setup About We wrote an entire book explaining the complex analytics landscape, so it‚Äôs fair to say that we know a thing or two about setting up data stack. Our data setup is as follows: Ingestion and Transformation: Event tracking (Snowplow) and ETLs from various data sources into our data lake (GCS) and data warehouse (BigQuery). The data is then transformed and moved to the data mart using dbt. Serving: Reporting is served on Holistics, and reverse-ETLs are handled to push data back into our CRMs for operational purposes. Orchestration: We use Prefect on top of the data stack to orchestrate and automate data pipelines and other operations. On the business side, we practice what we preach. That means instead of building reports and dashboards, Data team works to maintain a common set of metric definitions and educate the business users on how to self-serve the platform effectively. ‚Äç What We Look For In You We are seeking a candidate with a unique blend of technical depth and communication skills. Mindset A genuine interest in the data analytics / BI industry as a whole and a love for owning the entire data stack, not just one part of it. Systems thinking: You can reason about how business operations, data collection, and system architecture interact and affect one another. When you solve a problem once, you instinctively template it for the next fifty times. Excellent communication skills: You can communicate complex technical ideas clearly in both written and spoken English. You write like you code - clear, concise, and maintainable. Problem-solving orientation: You have solid problem decomposition skills and are energized by live problem-solving in workshops and discovery calls. Continuous learner: You possess a growth mindset and are excited to learn something new as part of your work every day. Technical Skills SQL: You have a good foundation in SQL. You can write readable queries to extract and manipulate data, and you can explain core concepts like grain and joins. Data Modeling: You are familiar with fundamental data modeling concepts (e.g., dimensional modeling) and schema designs (star/snowflake) and understand why we transform raw data into user-friendly formats. Programming: You have some experience with Python or an equivalent language for scripting and data manipulation tasks. Version Control: You are familiar with the basics of Git for tracking changes and collaborating on projects. Cloud Databases: You have exposure to, or academic experience with, a major cloud data warehouse (e.g., BigQuery, Snowflake, Redshift). Nice-to-haves: Exposure to dbt, Looker/LookML, Holistics, or other modern BI tools; a demonstrated interest in learning how data infrastructure empowers business decisions. ‚Äç Interview Process Round 1: A chat with the team and a light technical interview to discuss your skills, experience, and past projects.‚Äç Round 2: A short take-home assignment or on-site assignment to assess your technical and problem-solving skills.‚Äç Round 3: A culture and behavioral chat with management. ‚Äç Why You'll Love Working üíï Benefits Flexible working arrangement, hybrid work (WFO+WFH) policies 14 annual leaves, 14 sick leaves, and childcare leave policy. Annual budget for personal and professional growth, well-being, and interest cultivations. 24/7 healthcare insurance; periodic medical checkups. 13-month salary; annual compensation reviews Weekly happy hours, company-organized events. üè¢ Workstations provided for maximum productivity MacBook (or Laptop) Grant Mechanical Keyboard + Mouse Big-screen monitor(s) üåê Working time: From Monday ‚Äì Friday, from 9.00 a.m. to 6.00 p.m. üåê Work location: 457-459 Nguyen Dinh Chieu, Ward 5, District 3, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. Apply now

Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: Fundiin is the leading provider of Buy Now Pay Later solutions in Vietnam, dedicated to revolutionizing the fintech industry in Southeast Asia. Our vision is to be the most loved fintech solution, helping people deal with everyday financial problems. We strive to accelerate the path to financial freedom for everyone. We believe financial freedom does not mean being rich but rather being free from financial problems to have more time for what really matters. Position: Data Engineer Working Location:	77 Tran Nhan Ton, An Dong Ward 9, HCMC Direct report: Data Engineer Lead What you will do: As a Data Engineer at Fundiin, you will be responsible for designing, developing and maintaining the data pipelines from scratch to support our data-driven initiatives. Your work will play a key role in enabling data analysis, reporting, and compliance efforts across the company. Your responsibilities include but are not limited to: Build and operate production data pipelines using Apache Beam / Google Dataflow Maintain and extend dbt models (incremental models, tests, snapshots, documentation) Automate pipelines and scheduled jobs using Cloud Composer (Airflow) Implement data quality checks, logging and alerting to ensure pipeline reliability Work closely with Data Analyst / Data Scientist / Backend to serve data for credit scoring, fraud detection and business analytics Support MLOps workflows (feature pipelines, model deployment integration, model monitoring signals) Continuously improve cost efficiency, latency and stability of the data platform What you need to succeed in this role: 2+ years of hands-on experience as a Data Engineer (preferably in fintech / lending / payments) Solid SQL + Python skills in real production environments Experience building data pipelines with Beam / Dataflow or equivalent frameworks Experience maintaining dbt models (incremental models, tests, documentation) Experience with orchestration (Airflow / Cloud Composer) Comfortable working with cloud data platforms ( GCP : BigQuery, Pub/Sub, Cloud Storage) Understanding of pipeline observability (logging, alerting, data quality checks) Experience partnering with Data Science on MLOps workflows (feature pipelines, model deployment integration) is a plus Clear communication, ownership mentality, and willingness to iterate & improve existing systems Why you love working with us: Join Fundiin, where you can thrive in a dynamic fintech career, drive industry innovation, and make a meaningful impact on people's financial lives. We offer great autonomy, freedom to make decisions, and room to take risks and learn from mistakes Opportunity to be involved from the ground up in creating and developing new products, leading teams, working on innovative projects, and gaining visibility within the industry Competitive benefits package (including 13th-month salary) and meaningful ESOP Personal laptop allowances or financing options for new device purchases Learning support budget Premium healthcare plan and annual health check 15 days off per year Biannual Team Building Trips Spacious and collaborative office, free daily drinks and weekly TGIF snacks.

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: A leading global technology company in the fields of automatic data capture and factory automation, specializing in the development and production of barcode readers, mobile computers, sensors for detection, measurement, and safety, RFID, vision, and laser marking systems, is looking for an R&D Software Engineer. Reporting to the R&D Software Team Leader, the role focuses on designing, implementing, and documenting embedded software as part of the Software Development Teams for a specific business unit. Key Responsibilities: Follow internal processes for new product development. Design and implement complex software subsystems and systems within larger embedded products using best software engineering practices. Make design decisions autonomously and lead technical discussions. Troubleshoot designs and collaborate effectively with the Validation and Verification team. Participate in peer reviews of solution designs and code. Job Details & Specifications: Strong knowledge of embedded software system design and architecture. Proficiency in common development tools (e.g., git, cmake, vscode). Experience with software product lifecycle management practices (bug tracking, CI/CD pipelines). Practical experience in object-oriented programming (C++) and design patterns. Nice to Have: Familiarity with Linux kernel space programming (device drivers for I2C, SPI, PCI, USB). Experience with the Yocto project. Previous experience working in international teams.

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: The Job in short As a Senior Data Engineer , you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining the data platform for the Backbase Data as a Service (DaaS) Platform. Your experience and expertise in data engineering will ensure the success of the DaaS platform. The Data as a Service platform enables Backbase and their customers to perform big data analytics on data stored in the Engagement Banking Platform. You are expected to develop, maintain and test data infrastructure for retrieving data from many different data sources into a Data Lakehouse to enable data scientists and analyst to do their jobs. The Backbase Data Team is responsible for extracting data stored from the different systems in use in Backbase to unlock new insights and products built on top of the data platform. At Backbase we aim to deliver a turn-key Data as a Service platform built on top of the state Azure technology. The DaaS platform will enable customers from Backbase to run analytical, AI and ML workloads on data stored in the Engagement Banking Platform without affecting the operational state of the systems. You will develop and maintain the data pipelines for extracting data from many different sources, such as RDBMS, Change Data Capture and streaming endpoints. Captured data ranges from observability metrics to bank accounts and transactions that need to be processed in a highly secure and compliant manner. You guard the data consistency, quality and end to end governance from where data is born to where it is used in dashboards, AI / ML applications and other data consumers. Meet the job The Backbase Data Team is responsible for extracting data stored from the different systems in use in Backbase to unlock new insights and products built on top of the data platform. At Backbase we aim to deliver a turn-key Data as a Service platform built on top of the state Azure technology. The DaaS platform will enable customers from Backbase to run analytical, AI and ML workloads on data stored in the Engagement Banking Platform without affecting the operational state of the systems. You will develop and maintain the data pipelines for extracting data from many different sources, such as RDBMS, Change Data Capture and streaming endpoints. Captured data ranges from observability metrics to bank accounts and transactions that need to be processed in a highly secure and compliant manner. You guard the data consistency, quality and end to end governance from where data is born to where it is used in dashboards, AI / ML applications and other data consumers. How about you ‚óè A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field; ‚óè 5+ years of experience in data engineering, preferably in Azure Synapse, Spark, or Data Bricks; ‚óè Expertise in Data Lakehouse concepts and Delta Lake; ‚óè Deep understanding of data domains, regulations, and compliance requirements; ‚óè Strong leadership and project management skills; ‚óè Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: Top 3 reasons to join us Build AI that powers top global gaming studios World-class team from Harvard & FAANG High salary and bonus with proven market fit About Us Reforged Labs is a YC-backed, Sandhill Road funded AI startup revolutionizing how the world's top mobile gaming studios market themselves to hundreds of millions of players. We're building cutting-edge AI technology that powers sophisticated ad analysis and generation pipelines for elite global gaming companies. We don't follow trends; we set them. Our data infrastructure supports technology that generates millions of dollars in value for our customers, processing billions of gameplay and ad-performance signals in real-time. The Role We're seeking an exceptional Senior Data Engineer to join our fast-growing team in Ho Chi Minh City. This is not a role for the average analyst‚Äîwe're looking exclusively for extraordinary data talent who can compete with the best data engineers and analysts at top-tier companies globally. As our first data engineer , you'll set the foundation for data-driven decision making across our entire organization. You'll design and implement sophisticated analytics infrastructure that processes terabytes of gaming and advertising data, directly influencing product decisions that impact hundreds of millions of players. Core Responsibilities Define company-wide data strategy: Establish north-star metrics, experimentation frameworks, and analytics standards that will scale from startup to enterprise Build world-class data infrastructure: Design and implement pipelines processing billions of ad performance signals and gameplay events with exceptional reliability and speed Drive multi-million dollar decisions: Surface insights from massive datasets that directly influence product roadmap and customer strategy Own end-to-end analytics: From instrumentation design to executive dashboard delivery, ensuring data quality that leadership can bet the company on Lead advanced experimentation: Design and execute sophisticated A/B tests and multivariate experiments that optimize our AI-driven platform Establish data excellence standards: Create governance, quality, and best practices that will serve as the foundation for a world-class data team Champion data-informed culture: Influence technical and business decisions through exceptional analysis and clear communication Required Experience Your Skills and Experience 5+ years of elite-level experience in product analytics, growth analytics, or data science at fast-moving tech companies or high-growth startups Demonstrated mastery of SQL (MySQL dialect) and Python for complex analysis and ETL workflows Proven track record of building instrumentation and analytics for self-serve SaaS or consumer products at scale Production experience with modern data stack (dbt, Airflow/Prefect, Looker/Mode, cloud data warehouses) History of driving significant business impact through data insights and experimentation Expert-level understanding of statistical methods, A/B testing, and causal inference Professional English communication skills‚Äîboth verbal and written Essential Qualities Exceptional problem-solving ability: You consistently find insights others miss and solve complex analytical challenges independently Product intuition: You naturally think like a product leader and can translate business questions into analytical frameworks Technical excellence: You write clean, maintainable code and build systems that other engineers admire Intellectual curiosity: You stay ahead of data trends and continuously expand your analytical toolkit High ownership: You take full responsibility for data quality and business impact, not just deliverables Leadership mindset: You can influence without authority and drive consensus around data-driven decisions Nice to Have Data engineering background with end-to-end ETL ownership Experience with LLMs, vector databases, or recommendation systems Background in mobile gaming, ad tech, or marketing analytics Advanced statistical methods (Bayesian analysis, sequential testing) Contributions to open-source data or ML tools Why You'll Love Working Here What We Offer Industry-leading compensation package targeting top-tier data talent (significantly above local market rates) Unprecedented scope and autonomy as the data voice on the founding team with direct access to founders and strategic decisions Work on technology that is genuinely world-class, processing data at scales that compete with the best Silicon Valley companies Direct impact on products reaching hundreds of millions of users and generating millions in customer value Opportunity for international recognition and career advancement opportunities in the global data community Fast-iterating culture with real revenue insights and immediate feedback loops Annual offsites and dedicated learning budget for continuous skill development Flexible PTO and comprehensive health insurance Our Data Culture We operate with a data-first mindset where every major decision is backed by rigorous analysis. Our data infrastructure is built to Silicon Valley standards, combining cutting-edge tools with exceptional talent. You'll work directly with founders who understand that great data work requires both technical excellence and business acumen. We value independence and ownership‚Äîyou'll take full responsibility for establishing our data foundation and culture. Located in Ho Chi Minh City, we've created an environment that combines Silicon Valley data practices with exceptional local talent, offering the unique opportunity to work on global-scale data problems while being part of Vietnam's growing tech ecosystem. Reforged Labs is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company.

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade ‚Äì this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We‚Äôre focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success. ABOUT THE JOB Develop and maintain Modern Data Warehouse and Lakehouse solutions Use Kafka to stream raw data into data lake Develop and maintain data flows within Azure Perform data quality and metadata management Create data visualizations using Power BI and Tableau Collaborate directly with technical customers to design cloud-based technical architecture and approaches Support and troubleshoot data pipelines. ABOUT YOU Bachelor‚Äôs degree in data engineering, computer science or related fields 3+ years of experience in data engineering Expertise in Modern Data Warehouse and Lakehouse solutions, data quality, and metadata management Strong experience with Azure Synapse Analytics, Data Factory, Databricks, and Stream Analytics Proficiency in ETL/ELT processes and SQL/TSQL Experience in data modelling and pipeline orchestration with Azure tools Familiarity with Power BI Cloud and Tableau Microsoft Azure Data Engineer Associate (DP-203) certification is preferred Good communication skills in English and Vietnamese You have strong communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a multicultural environment. WHY AMARIS? job_description: Background Our mission is to provide a comprehensive, end-to-end data science service to the organization, covering everything from the underlying infrastructure and engineering to advanced analytics and data visualization. The Role You will be a key builder on a new initiative, channeling your deep expertise in production Python services into foundational tools that will be used by every engineer in the company. This role is for a hands-on engineer who is a master of their craft and fully empowered to own the implementation of our core developer libraries and templates, directly unblocking our most critical product initiatives. Responsibilities Own the end-to-end creation of our framework for on-demand Python services, including cookiecutter templates and the python-commons shared library. Implement the core patterns for writing reliable, observable, and performant Python microservices directly into our foundational libraries and templates. Partner closely with internal engineering teams to gather feedback and ensure the tools you build are intuitive, well-documented, and solve their most pressing problems. Consistently make pragmatic technical decisions that prioritize business value and delivery speed, in line with our early-stage startup environment. Collaborate on the design and initial implementation of our internal platform for deploying data science prototypes. Qualifications 5+ years of dedicated software engineering experience, with a strong focus on backend or platform systems. Proven expertise in building production Python services: architecting, building, and operating robust, scalable, and maintainable backend services. Deep backend knowledge, including concurrency models (e.g., asyncio), API design (REST, gRPC), performance optimization, and testing strategies for complex services. Full lifecycle experience: containerization (Docker), CI/CD, and production observability (structured logging, tracing, metrics). Passion for developer tooling: demonstrated ability to build tools, libraries, or frameworks that empower other developers. Familiarity with Go is a strong plus. Nice to have Experience with AWS core services in a platform context (Kubernetes/EKS, RDS, S3, IAM). Experience in a startup environment: comfortable with ambiguity and a fast-paced setting.

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: About the Company At Pizza Hut Global, we want to build the Winning Recipe for our Customers and Team to connect people through the joy of pizza. PHG has a vast amount of Operational, financial and consumer data to surface insights for our Team and Key Markets to improve the Customer Experience, execution of standards, and to increase sales. About the Role We‚Äôre looking for someone with a proven track record to be our Data Analyst for the Business Operations Team who is passionate about leveraging data to solve business problems and make data-driven strategic decisions. This role is central to helping us size opportunities, measure the effectiveness of our strategic priorities, and ensure the choices we make are grounded in rigorous data and translate into clear business value. The ideal candidate has ability to dive deep into the data sets, set up user friendly dashboards, present data back in a clear concise format utilizing Dashboards, Excel & PPT and plan a calendar of analysis to manage the intake. Responsibilities Data Analysis & Reporting: Collect, clean, and analyze data from multiple sources to produce key business insights. Design and deliver actionable reports and dashboards in reporting platforms. Ad-Hoc Analysis: Provide on-demand analysis to address specific business queries and support initiatives. Business Insights & Strategy: Collaborate with business leaders to deliver business insights to support decision-making across various departments, shaping strategy and creating understanding. Data Visualization & Dashboards: Develop dynamic, visually compelling dashboards that allow teams to monitor key metrics, track performance, and identify opportunities for improvement. Data Modeling: Use historical data to create predictive models and correlation outcomes, helping to plan for KPI performance and make proactive decisions. Data Integration: Work closely with data teams to ensure seamless integration of data sources, ensuring that data flows accurately and efficiently between systems. Data Quality & Integrity: Maintain data accuracy, consistency, and integrity in data systems, identify discrepancies, and work to resolve any data issues promptly. Presentation: Create and present back analysis in Excel / Dashboard / PPT format to clearly represent the data. Qualifications 2+ years experience in a similar role, with strong expertise in Snowflake and BI-based reporting. Experience in restaurant industry is a plus. Strong proficiency in Snowflake for data warehousing and querying. Expertise in DOMO and other BI-based for reporting, app-based dashboards, and data visualization. Proficiency in SQL, and experience with data analysis tools like Excel and Power BI. Familiarity with data modeling, ETL processes, and cloud-based data platforms. Strong understanding of statistical analysis and techniques. Experience working in a cross functional team. Ability to take data, turn it into insights and report back in clear concise format with recommendations for action. Strong organization and documentation skills. Relationship-building skills ‚Äì and ability to gain influence with key stakeholders in order to drive decisions. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Highly proactive and self motivated. Experience using Content Square or other user experience analysis tool advantageous. Pay range and compensation package 100% salary during the probation period 18 days of annual leave per year Five ‚ÄúRecharge Days‚Äù ‚Äì extra days in addition to company holidays One day of paid leave for your birthday Half-day Fridays Full salary insurance 13th-month bonus Advanced health insurance Regular team and engagement activities LinkedIn learning and training courses, based on company policy MacBook and monitors Pizza Hut, as a member of the Yum! Brands family recognizes the importance of having an inclusive culture with diverse team members and a steadfast commitment to developing a company culture where everyone feels respected. One of Pizza Hut‚Äôs core values is to believe in all people, and we create environments where differences are sought out and celebrated.

job_description: Overview As a cornerstone of Microsoft‚Äôs Substrate platform‚Äîthe underlying data infrastructure for Office 365 and other cloud services‚Äîthe Directory Runtime Stores team builds and maintains the storage systems that handle the runtime traffic for Microsoft‚Äôs directory services, supporting trillions of requests every day. Our systems are foundational to the reliability, scalability, and security of Microsoft‚Äôs cloud offerings. Joining our team as a Software Engineer means you‚Äôll have the opportunity to: Work on large-scale distributed systems that impact millions of users globally. Drive innovation in storage, traffic management, and automation, including AI-powered solutions. Collaborate with talented engineers across geographies and disciplines. Grow your technical expertise through challenging projects, mentorship, and a culture of continuous learning. Contribute to a team that values diversity, inclusion, and a growth mindset. Make a real difference by helping Microsoft empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. We are committed to modernizing our technical stack and delivering world-class performance and innovation for customers around the globe. Microsoft‚Äôs mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond. Responsibilities Work with appropriate stakeholders to determine user requirements for a set of features, ensuring alignment with business and technical goals. Contribute to the identification of dependencies and the development of design documents for product areas, with minimal oversight. Contribute to the development and integration of AI-native features and solutions, leveraging AI and automation to enhance system intelligence, scalability, and user experience. Create and implement code for products, services, or features, reusing code where applicable to drive efficiency and consistency. Break down larger work items into smaller, manageable tasks and provide accurate estimations for completion. Act as a Designated Responsible Individual (DRI), participating in on-call rotations to monitor system, product features, or services for degradation, downtime, or interruptions, and gain approval to restore services for simple problems. Remain current in technical skills by investing time and effort into learning new developments that improve availability, reliability, efficiency, observability, and Qualifications Required Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, or related technical discipline with proven experience coding in languages including, but not limited to, C, C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, or Python OR equivalent experience. Strong problem-solving, debugging, and analytical skills. Excellent communication and collaboration abilities. Passion for building scalable, reliable, and high-performance systems. Other Requirements Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter. Preferred Qualifications Master's Degree in Computer Science or related technical field with proven experience coding in languages including, but not limited to, C, C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, or Python OR Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related technical field AND 2+ years technical engineering experience with coding in languages including, but not limited to, C, C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, or Python OR equivalent experience. Experience with distributed systems or cloud-scale services. Familiarity with vibe coding in production environments.Solid communication skills in English. Experience working in large, cross-functional teams. This position will be open for a minimum of 5 days, with applications accepted on an ongoing basis until the position is filled. Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. job_description: A leading global technology company in the fields of automatic data capture and factory automation, specializing in the development and production of barcode readers, mobile computers, sensors for detection, measurement, and safety, RFID, vision, and laser marking systems, is looking for an R&D Software Engineer. Reporting to the R&D Software Team Leader, the role focuses on designing, implementing, and documenting embedded software as part of the Software Development Teams for a specific business unit. Key Responsibilities: Follow internal processes for new product development. Design and implement complex software subsystems and systems within larger embedded products using best software engineering practices. Make design decisions autonomously and lead technical discussions. Troubleshoot designs and collaborate effectively with the Validation and Verification team. Participate in peer reviews of solution designs and code. Job Details & Specifications: Strong knowledge of embedded software system design and architecture. Experience with the Yocto project. Previous experience working in international teams.

job_description: 1. Data Warehouse Design & Architecture ‚Ä¢ Design and maintain enterprise-level Data Warehouse solutions using dimensional modeling (star schema, snowflake schema, data marts). ‚Ä¢ Translate business requirements into logical and physical data models. ‚Ä¢ Ensure adherence to data standards, modeling principles, and naming conventions. 2. ETL / ELT Development ‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain ETL/ELT pipelines using T-SQL, Azure Data Factory, SSIS, or Synapse pipelines. ‚Ä¢ Integrate data from multiple systems: databases, APIs, file-based sources. ‚Ä¢ Ensure data quality, consistency, and stability across DW layers. 3. Database & Performance Engineering ‚Ä¢ Build and optimize database structures: tables, views, indexes, stored procedures, functions. ‚Ä¢ Conduct performance tuning for SQL queries and data loading processes. ‚Ä¢ Troubleshoot data issues and ensure high reliability of daily jobs. 4. Governance, Documentation & Collaboration ‚Ä¢ Apply data governance practices, including metadata management and lineage tracking. ‚Ä¢ Maintain thorough technical documentation for data models, ETL flows, and standards. ‚Ä¢ Work closely with Data Architects, BI Developers, and business stakeholders. ‚Ä¢ Provide DW layers that support BI, analytics, and self-service reporting. 5. Python & Notebook Support (Optional but valuable) ‚Ä¢ Use Jupyter Notebook / Synapse / Fabric notebooks for: ‚Ä¢ Exploratory data analysis (EDA) ‚Ä¢ Validating raw datasets ‚Ä¢ Prototyping ETL transformations ‚Ä¢ Quick data manipulation ‚Ä¢ Write basic/intermediate Python for data profiling, file handling (CSV/JSON/Parquet), and testing transformation logic before building production pipelines. üîß Requirements ‚Ä¢ 5+ years of experience in Data Warehouse Development or Data Engineering. Strong expertise in: ‚Ä¢ Dimensional modeling (Kimball, star/snowflake schema) ‚Ä¢ T-SQL and complex query development ‚Ä¢ ETL/ELT ‚Ä¢ Azure Data Platform (Data Factory, Azure SQL, Synapse) ‚Ä¢ Solid database knowledge: indexing, query plans, stored procedures, job scheduling. ‚Ä¢ Good understanding of data governance, metadata, documentation. ‚Ä¢ Experience working in Agile/Scrum environments. ‚Ä¢ Good English communication skills (written & spoken). ‚ú® Nice to Have ‚Ä¢ Experience with Microsoft Fabric or modern cloud data platforms. ‚Ä¢ Basic knowledge of Power BI for understanding downstream consumption. ‚Ä¢ Experience with CI/CD for data pipelines (Azure DevOps, Git). ‚Ä¢ Experience working with European or international clients. ‚Ä¢ Python skills for data exploration and notebook-based validation. üí° Why Join Us ‚Ä¢ Opportunity to work with a modern Azure-based data platform. ‚Ä¢ Strong collaboration with international teams (UK & EU). ‚Ä¢ Professional, flexible working environment. ‚Ä¢ High-impact role influencing DW architecture and data foundations

job_description: Company Description KMS Technology is a strategic engineering company helping businesses turn bold ideas into high-impact solutions‚Äîfaster. Founded in 2009 as a U.S.-based services company, we‚Äôve grown into a global organization with locations in the US, Vietnam, and Mexico. We bring deep expertise in product development and quality assurance, AI-native engineering, and delivery excellence to every engagement. Our mission is to help customers build what‚Äôs next‚Äîaccelerating innovation, crafting brilliant solutions, and creating real-world impact. At KMS, we believe sustainable growth is built on the success of our clients and employees and in making a lasting contribution to our communities within 3 main business sectors: Enterprise software development services: Leverage software domain expertise to help clients make better business decisions in technology platforms, increase speed-to-market, and gain critical development support through innovative technology solutions Healthcare technology solutions: Build transformative next-gen technologies to solve healthcare‚Äôs most challenging problems, providing innovative tools and expertise to providers, payers, life sciences, and medical technology vendors Banking, Financial Services & Insurance (BFSI) technology solutions: Empower BFSI businesses to embrace the digital finance revolution and expedite clients‚Äô journey towards complete digitalization, technology consulting, data analytics, software development, and software quality Job Description Your key responsibilities: Participate in all software development activities following Scrum process Contribute to the design and implementation of software features or subsystems using .NET technologies. Write high-quality code to implement software features or fix bugs Perform unit testing, documentation and all other activities defined in Definition of Done before passing source code to Testing team Communicate and report internally or directly to client on status or result of work Qualifications Your key qualifications: General requirements: 4th-year student or recent graduate with a Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field, with less than one (01) year of experience. Having knowledge of DevOps is a bonus. Possess strong foundation of OOP, data structures, and algorithms. Familiarity with web technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and RESTful APIs. Basic knowledge of unit testing and debugging techniques. Familiarity with source control tools such as Git. Understanding of software development best practices, including code maintainability and scalability. Hands-on experience through university projects or internship assignments related to web development. Additional Information Perks You'll Enjoy Working in one of the Best Places to Work in Vietnam Building large-scale & global software products Working & growing with Passionate & Talented Team Diverse careers opportunities with Software Outsourcing, Software Product Development, IT Solutions & Consulting Attractive Salary and Benefits Performance appraisals every year and performance bonus Onsite opportunities: short-term and long-term assignments in North American (U.S, Canada), Europe, Asia. job_description: Introduction Here at Skedulo we‚Äôre on a mission to support the 2.7 billion people in the world‚Äîand the companies that employ them‚Äîwho do not work at a desk every day. Our global teams are collaborative, ambitious, innovative, and passionate about helping our customers realize their fullest potential by enabling their mobile workforces. The Skedulo team is a tight-knit group of builders who are passionate about shaping our platform that is relied upon daily by thousands of users across the globe. We are looking for motivated, self-starters who share our values, challenge the status quo, and push the pace of innovation in order to accelerate growth. If you‚Äôre drawn to solving hard problems and want to help design software that will make a difference in people‚Äôs lives, Skedulo is for you. Visit our website to learn more about what Skedulo does and to learn more about our people and team. Description As a Senior Backend Engineer II at Skedulo, you will be a critical driver of technical excellence and product evolution within our core backend services. You will combine hands-on development with strategic technical leadership, significantly impacting the architecture, performance, scalability, and reliability of these services, and playing a key role in the delivery of new product capabilities. You will provide expert guidance, mentor colleagues, and solve complex or ambiguous issues within our backend systems, collaborating effectively in cross-functional teams to achieve product outcomes. Your ability to anticipate and address technical problems, coupled with your deep understanding of our core backend architecture, will be essential in maintaining and improving the stability, performance, and scalability of these services. You will also excel in influencing without direct authority, fostering collaboration, and driving outcomes across teams. You will be expected to work under broad direction and be fully responsible for meeting allocated technical and product objectives. Responsibilities Technical Leadership and Architecture: Architectural Guidance: Provide expert technical guidance and mentorship on architectural decisions, ensuring scalability, reliability, and maintainability. Influence key technical decisions to accommodate future use cases and scalability across the software architecture. Code Ownership: Own and drive the development of critical services within our core product, ensuring high code quality and adherence to best practices. Act as a go-to expert for understanding and navigating complex or legacy areas of the codebase. Cross-Team Collaboration: Facilitate and lead technical discussions and initiatives across engineering teams, resolving complex technical challenges. Set up connections across the organisation to drive collaborative product delivery. Observability and Incident Response: Drive observability work across our services and foster a culture of observability across your team and help them use operational data to improve stability and performance. Lead incident response when required, utilising a 'no blame' approach, ensuring clear communication and coordination. Participate in your team‚Äôs on-call roster. Development And Delivery Hands-on Development: Contribute significantly to the development and delivery of new product capabilities, writing high-quality code. Performance and Scalability: Identify and implement improvements to system performance, scalability, and stability. Technical Problem Solving: Proactively identify and resolve complex technical problems, anticipating potential blockers and delays. Code Reviews and Best Practices: Conduct thorough code reviews and promote best practices in coding, testing, and deployment. Mentorship And Communication Mentorship and Coaching: Mentor and coach engineers, fostering a culture of technical excellence and continuous learning. Effective Communication: Communicate complex technical concepts clearly and concisely to both technical and non-technical audiences. Influence Without Authority: Influence and drive consensus across teams and stakeholders, building strong relationships and fostering collaboration. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate effectively with product managers, designers, and other stakeholders to deliver high-quality products. Minimum Qualifications Must have at least 8-10+ years of experience in software development, with a proven track record of building and scaling distributed systems, with end to end responsibility for outcomes Expertise in Backend Technologies: Strong proficiency in backend technologies, including Java/Kotlin and Node.js, with a deep understanding of their respective ecosystems. Architectural Expertise: Demonstrated expertise in making critical architectural decisions, balancing trade-offs between factors such as performance, scalability, correctness, cost, and reliability to achieve optimal solutions. Cloud Technologies: Experience with cloud platforms (AWS preferred) and containerisation technologies (Docker, Kubernetes). Observability and Monitoring: Experience with observability tools and practices Expertise in working with ORMs and GraphQL APIs, ensuring efficient and scalable data access patterns. Strong experience in optimizing backend services for mobile applications Desired Skills & Experience Experience with offline-first architecture for mobile applications Expertise in push notifications, webSockets, and real-time data synchronization Familiarity and / or the ability to understand functional programming concepts and languages (Scala) Additional Qualifications Must be authorized to work in the country where this position is based without the need for visa sponsorship at time of application. Must have reliable internet connection and an at home workstation setup. (For remote positions) Benefits Global Offerings Competitive Salary Package including 13th month bonus New Hire Stock Options Employee Referral Bonus Program 3 volunteer days per year A generous budget to spend on setting up your home office or WFH station 100% employer paid access to Udemy (Learning & Development) Paid Parental Leave for both carers (12 weeks) Vietnam Specific Offerings Hybrid Work Model (3 days in the office & 2 days work from home) Private Medical Benefits (PTI Health Insurance) for employee + family 100% employer paid annual health check 7 paid sick leave days per year 20 paid personal leave days per year 12 paid public holiday days per year Company & Team Offsite Events provided Our office offers open and creative workspaces with room to play, reflect, and relax Our team works hard but also plays hard; we will challenge your best table tennis and PS4 skills Kitchen stocked with snacks & drinks
